questionListItems.title: How does a Donee use the Lasting Power of Attorney (LPA) to transact with the third party with Office of the Public Guardian Online (OPGO)?

answer.body:
A Donee can transact on a Donor’s behalf when the Donor has been certified by a registered medical practitioner to have lost mental capacity to handle his/her own affairs. When transacting with any third-party agency (e.g., banks, insurance agencies, HDB, CPFB, SLA, etc.), the Donee would need to produce the registered LPA and other supporting documents (e.g. identity document of the Donor and Donee) as required by the third-party agency.


With OPGO, the Donee can also send the electronic registered LPA to individuals or third-party organizations via OPGO.

questionListItems.title: I do not have a smart device/My phone is unable to install the Singpass application, but I would like to make an Lasting Power of Attorney (LPA). Where can I seek help?

answer.body:
To enjoy the benefit of making an online Lasting Power of Attorney (LPA), we would like to encourage you to approach persons you trust, such as your family members or loved ones, to set up your Singpass app on their spare smart device. Please follow the instructions below to set up your Singpass on the spare device:

  1. If the smart device's Singpass app has an existing Singpass account logged in, click on Settings on the Singpass app and reset the app following the in-app instructions.

  2. Set up the Singpass app with your Singpass Account by entering your Singpass ID and password. For local users with a mobile number registered with Singpass, enter the SMS One-Time Password sent to your mobile number. You may be prompted to perform a face scan enabled by Singpass Face Verification to authenticate your identity.

  3. Follow the in-app instructions to set up your 6-digit app passcode or biometric option.

  4. Reset the Singpass app using Step 1 after you have completed your LPA-related transactions before returning the phone.


If you are unable to obtain a spare smart device, you may submit a hardcopy LPA via mail or drop off at OPG’s office at 20 Lengkok Bahru #04-02, Family@Enabling Village, Singapore 159053. Please include a cover letter on why a hardcopy LPA is submitted. Do note that the acceptance of a hardcopy LPA is subject to OPG's approval.

questionListItems.title: Does my Donee need to accompany me when I have my Lasting Power of Attorney (LPA) certified?

answer.body: There is no requirement for the Donee(s) to be present when the Certificate Issuer (CI) witnesses and certifies on the LPA. However, some CIs may prefer that the Donee(s) are present so that the CI can explain the Donee’s duties to them. Hence, it would be best for Donors to check with the CI beforehand.

questionListItems.title: Can the doctor in polyclinic do the certification?

answer.body: Only doctors accredited by the Office of the Public Guardian can be Certificate Issuers to certify LPAs. You may search for a Certificate Issuer here: https://opg-eservice.msf.gov.sg/LPA/CIMapService.aspx.

questionListItems.title: Once I have started to draft my LPA, is there a deadline for the LPA to be submitted to OPG?

answer.body: You must submit your LPA to OPG for registration within 6 months from the date of your LPA application. This means that you must obtain your Donee's consent to be appointed and have your LPA certified by a Certificate Issuer within this period. After 6 months of creation of your LPA, your draft LPA will be removed from OPGO and you will need to redraft your LPA.

questionListItems.title: I am unable to download digital death certificate from My Legacy website even though it is within 30 days

answer.body:
You can download the digital death certificate from My Legacy website if the person has passed within 30 days from the date of issuance of death.

Please check if you have entered the information - i.e. death certificate number, date of death and deceased's NRIC number correctly.

If you have the Confirmation of Death number but do not have the death cert number, you should contact the doctor or hospital to ask for the death cert number, as the doctor may have overlooked to input the Confirmation of Death number into the system.

In the absence of a death certificate, you can use the Confirmation of Death document to arrange for the funeral and apply for cremation/burial. If you do not have this document, please approach the doctor/hospital for it.

If the doctor has already certified the death online, you may try to download the digital death certificate 24 hours later.

If the digital death certificate still cannot be downloaded, you may contact ICA at ICA_DPU_RBD@ica.gov.sg for assistance.

questionListItems.title: What should I do to prove that my Donor has lost mental capacity?

answer.body: If a Donor loses mental capacity, the Donee should download the medical report template on MSF's website: www.msf.gov.sg/docs/default-source/opg/medical-report-template-for-lpa-transactions and arrange for the Donor to be evaluated by a registered medical practitioner to certify that the Donor has lost mental capacity.

questionListItems.title: How do i make changes (e.g. changes to appointed donee) to my registered LPA?

answer.body:
To make changes to your appointed Donee (including adding/removing or changing a dionee) for a registered LPA, you would need to revoke your existing LPA and make a new one. The steps to revoke an LPA are as follows:

  1. Complete and sign the revocation form: https://www.msf.gov.sg/docs/default-source/default-document-library/revocation_form.pdf.

  1. Take reasonable steps to give written notice to every Donee that you are revoking the LPA by delivering it personally, sending it via post, or if the postal address is not known, via email

  2. Inform the Public Guardian of the revocation by providing the following items to the Office of the Public Guardian (OPG) by post or email:

  1. The completed and signed revocation form, and

  2. A photocopy of your ID.

  1. Pay the revocation fee of $30 via Office of the Public Guardian Online (OPGO) - MSF. OPG will provide instructions on how to make payment via email before processing your revocation.


The Public Guardian may also require you to provide further information or documents before revoking the registered LPA.

After submitting the revocation form, you may then proceed to make a new LPA on Office of the Public Guardian Online (OPGO) - MSF. Please note that you will need to have the LPA certified by a Certificate Issuer again - Find an LPA Certificate Issue before the new LPA can be submitted for registration.

questionListItems.title: How do I view the full copy of the Lasting Power of Attorney (LPA)?

answer.body:
Please follow the steps below to view the full LPA:
Step 1: Open the LPA with Adobe Acrobat Reader DC.
Step 2: Click on the paper clip icon located on the left panel. This opens up a tab called ‘Attachments’.
Step 3: Double click the attachment named LPA Form_Certified_XXXXX.pdf to view your full LPA.

Please ensure that your device’s default setting is opening the PDF via Adobe instead of web browser. Proceed with downloading a copy, and at your downloads folder, right click and choose ‘Open with Adobe Acrobat Reader’. You will be able to see the paper clip icon after

answer.body: The government-managed columbaria at Choa Chu Kang and Mandai are not for advance sale. Applicants will need to provide a death certificate of the deceased at the point of payment.

questionListItems.title: Can I get the digital death certificate for deaths which occurred before 29 May 2022?

answer.body:
Digital death certificates are only issued for deaths which occurred after 29 May 2022. If you need a copy of your late NOK's death certificate, you can apply for a death extract online via https://go.gov.sg/ica-extracts. Please note you would be required to provide the following information of your late NOK:


  1. Full name,

  2. Date of death and,

  3. Singapore death certificate number or NRIC number


You can also find more information regarding the application of a death extract here: https://www.ica.gov.sg/documents/death/apply_extract

questionListItems.title: If my next-of-kin passes away outside Singapore, should I report the death in the foreign country or in Singapore?

answer.body: For deaths that happened overseas, the deceased's next-of-kin should register the death and obtain a death certificate from the foreign authorities in the country where the person had passed on. After that, you may report the death to ICA with the foreign death certificate. For more information, please refer to https://www.ica.gov.sg/documents/death/death_overseas

questionListItems.title: Is it possible to issue the death certicate in another language?

answer.body: All death certificates issued by ICA are in English. ICA does not issue death certificates in any other languages. You may wish to have the document translated by a translator/agency recognised by the foreign authorities. Please check with the foreign authorities on their requirements.
